steps.description: Customer reports an incident via web portal, mobile app, or call centre; captures policy number, incident type (e.g., Home-Buildings, Home-Contents, Car-Comprehensive), date/time, photos, and initial estimate; creates claim record and returns claim reference.
steps.businessRationale: Fast, low-friction reporting increases claim capture and reduces call centre load; immediate creation of claim record enables downstream workflows and SLA timers that affect customer satisfaction and regulatory reporting.

steps.description: Automated triage evaluates incident severity, policy cover, and immediate assistance needs; identity and fraud checks run; urgent claims flagged for fast-track; initial reserve estimated and supplier (repairer/assessor) selection started.
steps.businessRationale: Automated triage reduces manual handling costs and speeds time-to-first-response; accurate validation prevents fraudulent payouts and ensures correct reserving which impacts loss ratio and capital planning.

steps.description: Claims assessor (remote or on-site) reviews evidence, inspects damage (if required), obtains repair quotes or supplier estimates, and finalises recommended settlement amount; updates claim record with estimate and expected timeline.
steps.businessRationale: Assessment is the most resource-intensive step; timely assessments reduce cycle time and supplier costs. Long assessment delays increase customer dissatisfaction and raise churn risk, while rushed assessments increase overpayment risk.

steps.description: Underwriting/claims authority reviews assessment, approves settlement or requests additional information; if approved, settlement type chosen (repair via approved supplier or cash payout); reserve updated and approval event recorded.
steps.businessRationale: Clear, auditable approval reduces regulatory risk and ensures correct financial controls. Delays here block payouts and repairs, increasing customer dissatisfaction and potential legal exposure.

steps.description: If repair chosen, supplier is booked and repair progress tracked; if payout chosen, payment instruction created and executed via payments gateway; supplier invoices reconciled and ledger updated; customer notified of progress and expected completion.
steps.businessRationale: Execution is where cash flows and supplier relationships are realised. Efficient supplier orchestration and reliable payments reduce claim costs and speed resolution, improving NPS and lowering churn risk.

steps.description: Claim closed after repair completion or payout; final reserve released; customer receives closure notification, e-receipt, and NPS survey; claim data archived for analytics and fraud scoring updates.
steps.businessRationale: Timely closure and feedback collection drive retention and provide data for continuous improvement. Closure events feed analytics for loss ratio, supplier performance, and customer lifetime value calculations.
